ext2

Class DataBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • ext2.DataBlock
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Directory, Ext2File, GroupDescriptor, INode, SuperBlock

    public abstract class DataBlock
extends java.lang.Object
    Name: DataBlock This class represents any data block which contains a sequence of bytes in the volume the user opened. This class contains various methods which operate on arrays of bytes specified by the user (e.g. opening a file).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataBlock(Volume vol)
      Constructor to initialise a data block represented inside a given volume.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Volume getVolume()
      Returns the volume that this data block is located in.
      byte[] readBlock(long startByte, long length)
      Reads at most length bytes starting at byte offset startByte from start of file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataBlock

        public DataBlock(Volume vol)
        Constructor to initialise a data block represented inside a given volume.
        Parameters:
        vol - The passed volume instance.

    • Method Detail

      • readBlock

        public byte[] readBlock(long startByte,
                        long length)
        Reads at most length bytes starting at byte offset startByte from start of file. Byte 0 is first byte in the file.
        Parameters:
        startByte - The byte to begin reading from in the file.
        length - The total number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        The array of bytes from the file.

      • getVolume

        public Volume getVolume()
        Returns the volume that this data block is located in.
        Returns:
        The volume instance.
